articles.title: –ö–∞–∫ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π: –§—Ä–∞–∑—ã –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–∫–∏
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–ü—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä—É–∫–∏ –∏ —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ –≤–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞ ‚Äî –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∏–∑ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∂–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤. –ù–µ–∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ –æ—Ç —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç–µ –ª–∏ –≤—ã –≥—Ä–∞–Ω–¥–∏–æ–∑–Ω–æ–µ frieriet –∏–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π, —Å–µ—Ä–¥–µ—á–Ω—ã–π –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç, –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∑–∏—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–∏ –Ω–∞–º–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ, —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç —ç—Ç—É –≤–µ—Ö—É –Ω–µ–∑–∞–±—ã–≤–∞–µ–º–æ–π. –≠—Ç–æ —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ –æ—Ö–≤–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤—Å—ë: –æ—Ç –∏–¥–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–æ –æ–±—ä—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ –≤–∞—à–µ–π forlovelsen —Å–µ–º—å–µ –∏ –¥—Ä—É–∑—å—è–º.

–î–ª—è –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞—à–µ —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ [–ª–∞—Å–∫–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–º–µ–Ω–∞ –∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ –Ω–µ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π](/blog/ru/danish-pet-names-and-terms-of-endearment).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Vil du gifte dig med mig?"
  translation="–¢—ã –≤—ã–π–¥–µ—à—å –∑–∞ –º–µ–Ω—è?"
  pronunciation="Vil du gifte dig med mig?"
  context="–°–∞–º—ã–π –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–π –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –≤—ã –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞-–ª–∏–±–æ –∑–∞–¥–∞–¥–∏—Ç–µ."
/>

## –õ–µ–∫—Å–∏–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è

–û—Å–≤–æ–π—Ç–µ —ç—Ç–∏ –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –≤–∞—à–∏–º –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–º –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–º:

<VocabCard
  word="ringen"
  translation="–∫–æ–ª—å—Ü–æ"
  pronunciation="ringen"
  example="ringen –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–∫–∏ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–æ —Å–≤–µ—Ä–∫–∞–µ—Ç."
/>

| Danish | –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π | –ö–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç |
|---|---|---|
| frieriet | –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ê–∫—Ç –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è |
| forlovelsen | –ø–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–∫–∞ | –ü–µ—Ä–∏–æ–¥ –¥–æ —Å–≤–∞–¥—å–±—ã |
| ringen | –∫–æ–ª—å—Ü–æ | –û–±—Ä—É—á–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –∫–æ–ª—å—Ü–æ |
| forlovede | –∂–µ–Ω–∏—Ö | –ü–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –º—É–∂—á–∏–Ω–∞ |
| forlovede | –Ω–µ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∞ | –ü–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∂–µ–Ω—â–∏–Ω–∞ |
| ja | –¥–∞ | –û—Ç–≤–µ—Ç, –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –≤—ã –Ω–∞–¥–µ–µ—Ç–µ—Å—å |
| for evigt | –Ω–∞–≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ | –ù–∞ –≤–µ—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å |
| mit livs k√¶rlighed | –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å –≤—Å–µ–π –º–æ–µ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ | –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ |

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá∞" title="–¢—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è">
–í –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–∞—Ö, –≥–¥–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –Ω–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ, —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥–≤–∞—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –±–ª–∞–≥–æ—Å–ª–æ–≤–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π. –≠—Ç–æ—Ç —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∂–µ—Å—Ç –ø–æ-–ø—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–µ–º—É —Ü–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—Å—è –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–º–∏ —Å–µ–º—å—è–º–∏ –∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–æ–µ –≤–ø–µ—á–∞—Ç–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ.
</CultureTip>

## –°–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—ã —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ

### –ö–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ
**"Vil du gifte dig med mig?"** - –¢—ã –≤—ã–π–¥–µ—à—å –∑–∞ –º–µ–Ω—è?

–≠—Ç–æ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π, –ø—Ä—è–º–æ–π –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –¥–ª—è –ª—é–±–æ–π –æ–±—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫–∏. –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–π—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –ø–æ–∫–∞ –æ–Ω–æ –Ω–µ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ—Ç –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º.

### –ë–æ–ª–µ–µ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç—ã
- **"–¢—ã mit livs k√¶rlighed. Vil du gifte dig med mig?"** - –î–æ–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ –ª—é–±–≤–∏
- **"–Ø —Ö–æ—á—É –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ —Å —Ç–æ–±–æ–π for evigt."** - –ü–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞ –∫ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—É
- **"–¢—ã —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—à—å –º–µ–Ω—è —Å–∞–º—ã–º —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç–ª–∏–≤—ã–º —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–æ–º –Ω–∞ —Å–≤–µ—Ç–µ?"** - –ê–ª—å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥

<VocabCard
  word="forlovet"
  translation="–ø–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–ª–µ–Ω(–∞)"
  pronunciation="forlovet"
  example="–ú—ã forlovet!"
/>

## –û–±—ä—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ –ø–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–∫–µ

–ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤–∞—à –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä —Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç "ja!", –≤—ã –∑–∞—Ö–æ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ –ø–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç—å—é:

### –î–ª—è —Å–µ–º—å–∏
- **"–ú—ã forlovet!"** - –†–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—ä—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ
- **"forlovede/forlovede —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª(–∞) ja!"** - –†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª—è—è –≤–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ
- **"–£ –Ω–∞—Å —á—É–¥–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–∏!"** - –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–≤–∫—É—à–µ–Ω–∏—è

### –î–ª—è –¥—Ä—É–∑–µ–π
- **"–£–≥–∞–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ, —á—Ç–æ —Å–ª—É—á–∏–ª–æ—Å—å?"** - –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏–Ω—Ç—Ä–∏–≥–∏
- **"–ü–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –º–æ—ë ringen!"** - –î–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –∫–æ–ª—å—Ü–∞
- **"–ú—ã –∂–µ–Ω–∏–º—Å—è!"** - –ü—Ä—è–º–æ –∏ —Ä–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ

### –í —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç—è—Ö
- **"–û–Ω–∞/–û–Ω —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª(–∞) ja!"** - –ö–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –æ–±—ä—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ
- **"for evigt –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å!"** - –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å—å
- **"forlovet —Å –º–æ–µ–π mit livs k√¶rlighed"** - –°–µ—Ä–¥–µ—á–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá∞" title="–ü—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–∫–∏">
–í–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö —Å–µ–º—å—è—Ö, –≥–¥–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –Ω–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ, —É—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–∫–∞ –≤ —á–µ—Å—Ç—å forlovelsen –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø–∞—Ä—ã. –≠—Ç–æ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è–µ—Ç –æ–±–µ–∏–º —Å–µ–º—å—è–º –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∏ –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ—è—â–∏–π —Å–æ—é–∑ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ.
</CultureTip>

## –õ–µ–∫—Å–∏–∫–∞ –æ –∫–æ–ª—å—Ü–µ

ringen ‚Äî —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç frieriet:

| Danish | –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π | –û–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ |
|---|---|---|
| ringen | –∫–æ–ª—å—Ü–æ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ |
| –ø–æ–º–æ–ª–≤–æ—á–Ω–æ–µ ringen | –æ–±—Ä—É—á–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –∫–æ–ª—å—Ü–æ | –°–∏–º–≤–æ–ª –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ |
| –±—Ä–∏–ª–ª–∏–∞–Ω—Ç | –±—Ä–∏–ª–ª–∏–∞–Ω—Ç | –ü–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã–π –∫–∞–º–µ–Ω—å |
| –∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–æ | –∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–æ | –†–∞—Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–π –º–µ—Ç–∞–ª–ª |

## –ü–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞ –∫ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—é

### –°–æ–≤–µ—Ç—ã –ø–æ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–µ
1. **–ó–∞–ø–∏—à–∏—Ç–µ —Å–µ–±—è**, –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ
2. **–ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—å —Å –∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–º –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞**
3. **–†–∞—Å—Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–π—Ç–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è** –¥–ª—è –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–≤—É—á–∞–Ω–∏—è
4. **–ü–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—å—Ç–µ—Å—å –∫ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏—è–º** ‚Äî –Ω–µ—Ä–≤–Ω–∏—á–∞—Ç—å ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ

### –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—ã
–†–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ —ç—Ç–∏ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã:
- –ó–Ω–∞—á–∏–º–æ–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ
- –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç
- –ö—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ, –∫—Ç–æ —Å—Ñ–æ—Ç–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç (—Ç–∞–π–Ω–æ!)
- ringen –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–æ –∏ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–æ

## –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –æ–Ω–∞/–æ–Ω —Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç ¬´–¥–∞¬ª

–ú–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ frieriet –≤–æ–ª—à–µ–±–Ω—ã:

| –ú–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç | –ß—Ç–æ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å | –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ |
|---|---|---|
| –°—Ä–∞–∑—É –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ | –Ø —Ç–∞–∫ —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é! | –ü—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –ª—é–±–≤–∏ |
| –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –∑–≤–æ–Ω–æ–∫ | –ú—ã forlovet! | –û–±—ä—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ |
| –ü–µ—Ä–≤–æ–µ —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ | –ú–æ–π(—è) forlovede/forlovede! | –ù–æ–≤–æ–µ –æ–±—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ |

–î–ª—è –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–æ–≤ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∑–∏—Ç—å –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å –∏–∑—É—á–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞—à–µ —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ [–∫–∞–∫ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å ¬´—è –ª—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±—è¬ª –Ω–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π](/blog/ru/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-danish).

## –ö—Ä–∞—Ç–∫–∏–π —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫

| –¶–µ–ª—å | –§—Ä–∞–∑–∞ |
|---|---|
| –ü—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ | Vil du gifte dig med mig? |
| –†–µ–∞–∫—Ü–∏—è –Ω–∞ ¬´–¥–∞¬ª | –¢—ã —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª(–∞) ja! |
| –û–±—ä—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ú—ã forlovet! |
| –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ú–æ–π(—è) forlovede/forlovede |

–í–∞—à–µ frieriet –Ω–∞ –¥–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ—Ç –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–µ–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –≤—ã –±—É–¥–µ—Ç–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å for evigt. –ù–µ —Ç–æ—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å, –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –æ—Ç —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–∞, –∏ –ø—É—Å—Ç—å –≤–∞—à–∞ –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å —Å–∏—è–µ—Ç –≤ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–º —Å–ª–æ–≤–µ.

<CTA />

articles.title: T√∂r√∂k esk√ºv≈ëi kifejez√©sek: Sz√≥kincs a nagy napra
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

A p√°rod esk√ºv≈ëi napja az √©letetek egyik legfontosabb pillanata. Ha t√∂r√∂kul tudsz kifejezni magad a szertart√°s, a k√∂sz√∂nt≈ëk √©s az √ºnnepl√©s sor√°n, ez a k√ºl√∂nleges nap m√©g eml√©kezetesebb√© v√°lik. Ak√°r t√∂r√∂k nyelvter√ºleten h√°zasodtok, ak√°r tisztelegni szeretn√©l a p√°rod √∂r√∂ks√©ge el≈ëtt, ezek a kifejez√©sek seg√≠tenek.

Ha m√©g az alapokat tanulod, n√©zd meg a [Hogyan mondd: Szeretlek t√∂r√∂kul](/learn/hu/tr/turkish-how-to-say-i-love-you) √∫tmutat√≥nkat.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Tebrikler!"
  translation="Gratul√°lok!"
  pronunciation="teb…æikÀàle…æ"
  context="Az esk√ºv≈ëi k√∂sz√∂nt√©s alapja."
/>

## Alapvet≈ë sz√≥kincs

Kezdj√ºk az alapvet≈ë esk√ºv≈ëi sz√≥kinccsel, amivel minden t√∂r√∂k esk√ºv≈ën tal√°lkozni fogsz:

## Hasznos kifejez√©sek

### Gratul√°ci√≥k √©s j√≥k√≠v√°ns√°gok

Amikor gratul√°lsz a boldog p√°rnak, ezek a kifejez√©sek seg√≠tenek:

- **Tebrikler!** - Gratul√°lok!
- **Sok boldogs√°got k√≠v√°nok!** - Hagyom√°nyos j√≥k√≠v√°ns√°g
- **Legyetek boldogok!** - Egyszer≈±, sz√≠vb≈ël j√∂v≈ë k√≠v√°ns√°g

### K√∂sz√∂nt≈ëk

- **Emeljen poharat!** - Felh√≠v√°s a k√∂sz√∂nt≈ëre
- **A boldog p√°rra!** - Egyszer≈± k√∂sz√∂nt≈ë
- **A szerelemre!** - Romantikus k√∂sz√∂nt≈ë

<CultureTip flag="üí°" title="Hasznos tipp">
Gyakorold a kiejt√©st a nagy nap el≈ëtt. Nem baj, ha nem besz√©lsz t√∂k√©letesen - a p√°rod √©s csal√°dja √©rt√©kelni fogja az er≈ëfesz√≠t√©st.

## √ñsszefoglal√≥ t√°bl√°zat

articles.title: Deense Zinnen voor Ruzie en Meningsverschillen
articles.content:
Denemarken is bekend om "hygge" ‚Äì gezelligheid en comfort. Maar ook Deense stellen kennen momenten van onenigheid. Deze gids helpt je om meningsverschillen met je Deense partner effectief te bespreken.

## Deense communicatiecultuur

Denen zijn direct en eerlijk, vergelijkbaar met Nederlanders. Ze waarderen openheid maar houden ook van harmonie. Humor speelt vaak een rol, zelfs in serieuze gesprekken.

## Essenti√´le zinnen voor meningsverschillen

### 1. "Jeg f√∏ler mig s√•ret, n√•r du..."
**Betekenis:** Ik voel me gekwetst als je...

**Uitspraak:** *jai feu-ler mai so-ret, nor due*

Focust op je gevoelens.

### 2. "Kan vi tale roligt om det her?"
**Betekenis:** Kunnen we hier rustig over praten?

**Uitspraak:** *kan vie ta-le ro-liet om dee heer*

Uitnodiging voor kalmte.

### 3. "Jeg forst√•r dit synspunkt, men..."
**Betekenis:** Ik begrijp je standpunt, maar...

**Uitspraak:** *jai for-stor diet suens-poenkt, men*

Erkenning eerst.

### 4. "Jeg har brug for et √∏jeblik til at falde til ro"
**Betekenis:** Ik heb even een moment nodig om te kalmeren

**Uitspraak:** *jai har broe for et oi-e-blik til at fal-le til roe*

Ruimte vragen.

### 5. "Det var ikke det, jeg mente"
**Betekenis:** Dat is niet wat ik bedoelde

**Uitspraak:** *dee var ie-ke dee, jai men-te*

Misverstanden ophelderen.

### 6. "V√¶r s√∏d at lytte til mig"
**Betekenis:** Wees lief en luister naar me

**Uitspraak:** *veer seud at lue-te til mai*

Vraag om aandacht.

### 7. "Kan du forklare, hvordan du har det?"
**Betekenis:** Kun je uitleggen hoe je je voelt?

**Uitspraak:** *kan due for-kla-re, vor-dan due har dee*

Toont interesse.

### 8. "Jeg vil ikke sk√¶ndes om det her"
**Betekenis:** Ik wil hier geen ruzie over maken

**Uitspraak:** *jai viel ie-ke sken-des om dee heer*

Signaal voor de-escalatie.

### 9. "Lad os finde et kompromis sammen"
**Betekenis:** Laten we samen een compromis vinden

**Uitspraak:** *lad os fien-ne et kom-pro-mies sa-men*

Samenwerking voorstellen.

### 10. "Undskyld, at jeg h√¶vede stemmen"
**Betekenis:** Sorry dat ik mijn stem verhief

**Uitspraak:** *oen-sjuel, at jai hee-ve-the stem-men*

Excuses aanbieden.

### 11. "Det her er meget vigtigt for mig"
**Betekenis:** Dit is heel belangrijk voor mij

**Uitspraak:** *dee heer er mai-et viek-tiet for mai*

Benadrukt het belang.

## Culturele overwegingen

**Hygge:** Dit Deense concept van gezelligheid en comfort is belangrijk. Na een ruzie kan het herstellen van hygge helpen bij verzoening.

**Janteloven:** Net als in andere Scandinavische landen is bescheidenheid een waarde.

**Humor:** Denen gebruiken vaak droge humor, zelfs in serieuze situaties. Dit kan helpen om spanning te verlichten.

**Directheid:** Denen zijn direct, wat goed past bij de Nederlandse communicatiestijl.

## Conclusie

Met deze Deense zinnen kun je meningsverschillen bespreken terwijl je de Deense waarden van openheid en harmonie respecteert.

articles.title: D√°n fl√∂rt√∂l≈ës kifejez√©sek
articles.content:
# D√°n fl√∂rt√∂l≈ës kifejez√©sek magyar anyanyelv≈±eknek

A d√°n nyelv a skandin√°v nyelvcsal√°d r√©sze, egyedi kiejt√©ssel. A d√°n kult√∫ra a "hygge" (kellemes, meghitt hangulat) k√∂r√© √©p√ºl, √©s ez a romantik√°ban is megjelenik. Ismerd meg ezeket a kifejez√©seket!

## Alapvet≈ë fl√∂rt√∂l≈ës kifejez√©sek

### 1. Du er meget smuk (D√º √©r m√°jed szmuk)
**Jelent√©s:** Nagyon sz√©p vagy (n≈ënek)

**Kiejt√©s:** d√º √âR M√Å-jed SZMUK

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** A d√°nok visszafogottak ‚Äì egy egyszer≈±, ≈ëszinte b√≥k t√∂bbet √©r a t√∫lz√°sn√°l.

---

### 2. Du har flotte √∏jne (D√º h√°r flotte √∂jne)
**Jelent√©s:** Sz√©p szemeid vannak

**Kiejt√©s:** d√º H√ÅR FLOT-te √ñJ-ne

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** A szemek dics√©rete klasszikus √©s elfogadott b√≥k D√°ni√°ban.

---

### 3. Vil du have en kop kaffe med mig? (Vil d√º h√© en kop k√°ffe med m√°j?)
**Jelent√©s:** Szeretn√©l velem k√°v√©zni?

**Kiejt√©s:** vil d√º H√â en KOP K√ÅF-fe med M√ÅJ

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** A k√°v√©z√°s n√©pszer≈± t√°rsas√°gi tev√©kenys√©g ‚Äì kellemes √©s k√∂tetlen randev√∫kezdet.

---

### 4. Jeg kan godt lide dig (J√°j kan got li d√°j)
**Jelent√©s:** Kedvellek / Tetszel nekem

**Kiejt√©s:** j√°j kan GOT LI d√°j

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** Egyszer≈± √©s k√∂zvetlen kifejez√©s ‚Äì a d√°nok √©rt√©kelik az ≈ëszintes√©get.

---

### 5. Jeg vil gerne l√¶re dig bedre at kende (J√°j vil g√©rne l√©re d√°j b√©dre at kenne)
**Jelent√©s:** Jobban meg szeretn√©lek ismerni

**Kiejt√©s:** j√°j vil G√âR-ne L√â-re d√°j BED-re at KEN-ne

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** Ez komolyabb sz√°nd√©kot mutat √©s megnyitja az utat a m√©lyebb kapcsolathoz.

---

### 6. Du er s√• s√∏d (D√º √©r sz√≥ sz√∂d)
**Jelent√©s:** Olyan aranyos vagy

**Kiejt√©s:** d√º √âR sz√≥ SZ√ñD

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** A "s√∏d" sz√≥ kedves √©s j√°t√©kos jelz≈ë.

---

### 7. Kan jeg f√• dit nummer? (Kan j√°j f√≥ dit nummer?)
**Jelent√©s:** Megkaphatom a telefonsz√°modat?

**Kiejt√©s:** kan j√°j F√ì dit NUM-mer

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** Ha pozit√≠v a l√©gk√∂r, ez elfogadott k√©r√©s.

---

### 8. Du har et dejligt smil (D√º h√°r et d√°jlit szmil)
**Jelent√©s:** Sz√©p mosolyod van

**Kiejt√©s:** d√º H√ÅR et D√ÅJ-lit SZMIL

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** A mosoly dics√©rete mindig kedves √©s term√©szetes.

---

### 9. Det er hyggeligt at snakke med dig (Det √©r h√ºggelit at sznakke med d√°j)
**Jelent√©s:** J√≥ veled besz√©lgetni (kellemes/meghitt)

**Kiejt√©s:** det √âR H√úG-ge-lit at SZNAK-ke med D√ÅJ

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** A "hyggeligt" kulcssz√≥ ‚Äì a d√°n kult√∫ra l√©nyeg√©t fejezi ki: melegs√©g, k√©nyelem, j√≥ hangulat.

---

### 10. Skal vi ses igen? (Sk√°l vi sz√©sz √≠gen?)
**Jelent√©s:** Tal√°lkozzunk √∫jra?

**Kiejt√©s:** sk√°l vi SZ√âSZ √ç-gen

**Kultur√°lis tipp:** Egyszer≈± √©s bar√°ts√°gos m√≥dja a k√∂vetkez≈ë tal√°lkoz√°s javasl√°s√°nak.

---

## Kultur√°lis tudnival√≥k a d√°n fl√∂rt√∂l√©sr≈ël

A d√°n t√°rsadalom egyenl≈ës√©gp√°rti √©s inform√°lis ‚Äì a n≈ëk √©s f√©rfiak egyar√°nt kezdem√©nyezhetnek. A t√∫lzott udvarl√°s vagy h√≠zelg√©s furcs√°nak t≈±nhet.

A "hygge" koncepci√≥ k√∂zponti: a d√°nok szeretik a meghitt, kellemes l√©gk√∂rt. Egy gyertyaf√©nyes k√°v√©z√°s vagy egy k√∂tetlen s√©ta t√∂k√©letes randev√∫√∂tlet.

A d√°nok kezdetben tart√≥zkod√≥ak lehetnek, de az alkoholos √∂sszej√∂veteleken (pl. p√©ntek esti b√°rok) gyakran nyitottabbak. L√©gy ≈ëszinte √©s term√©szetes ‚Äì a d√°nok √©rt√©kelik az autentikuss√°got!

articles.title: German Arguing & Disagreement Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Every relationship faces disagreements. When your partner speaks German, being able to express yourself during conflicts in their language demonstrates commitment and respect. Here are essential German phrases for navigating difficult conversations.

## Expressing Disagreement

### Ich bin nicht einverstanden
**Pronunciation:** ikh bin nikht INE-fair-shtan-den

**Meaning:** "I don't agree" or "I disagree"

**When to use it:** The straightforward way to express disagreement in German. It's clear and direct without being aggressive.

**Example:** "Ich bin nicht einverstanden mit dem, was du gesagt hast." (I don't agree with what you said.)

### Das ist nicht fair
**Pronunciation:** dahs ist nikht FAIR

**Meaning:** "That's not fair"

**When to use it:** When something feels inequitable. Germans often value fairness highly, so this phrase carries weight.

### Du verstehst mich falsch
**Pronunciation:** doo fair-SHTAYST mikh FALSH

**Meaning:** "You're misunderstanding me"

**When to use it:** When your words or intentions are being misinterpreted. This helps refocus on clear communication.

### Du h√∂rst mir nicht zu
**Pronunciation:** doo HEHRST meer nikht TSOO

**Meaning:** "You're not listening to me"

**When to use it:** When you feel unheard during a discussion. This phrase asks for attention and engagement.

## Expressing Frustration

### Ich bin frustriert
**Pronunciation:** ikh bin froos-TREERT

**Meaning:** "I'm frustrated"

**When to use it:** To directly name your emotional state. German speakers often appreciate straightforward expression of feelings.

### Es st√∂rt mich, wenn...
**Pronunciation:** es SHTEHRT mikh, ven

**Meaning:** "It bothers me when..."

**When to use it:** To express specific behaviors that upset you without attacking your partner's character.

**Example:** "Es st√∂rt mich, wenn du zu sp√§t kommst, ohne Bescheid zu sagen." (It bothers me when you arrive late without letting me know.)

### Ich brauche einen Moment
**Pronunciation:** ikh BROW-khuh INE-en moh-MENT

**Meaning:** "I need a moment"

**When to use it:** When you need a pause to collect your thoughts and emotions before continuing.

### Das verletzt mich
**Pronunciation:** dahs fair-LETST mikh

**Meaning:** "That hurts me"

**When to use it:** To express emotional pain caused by something your partner said or did.

## Setting Boundaries

### Sprich nicht so mit mir
**Pronunciation:** shprikh nikht ZOH mit meer

**Meaning:** "Don't talk to me like that"

**When to use it:** When your partner's tone becomes disrespectful. Sets a clear boundary.

### Das geht zu weit
**Pronunciation:** dahs gayt tsoo VITE

**Meaning:** "That's going too far"

**When to use it:** When a line has been crossed in what's being said or done during an argument.

### Wir m√ºssen ruhig dar√ºber sprechen
**Pronunciation:** veer MOOS-en ROO-ikh dah-ROO-ber SHPREKH-en

**Meaning:** "We need to talk about this calmly"

**When to use it:** To de-escalate and invite more productive dialogue.

## Seeking Resolution

### K√∂nnen wir zusammen eine L√∂sung finden?
**Pronunciation:** KER-nen veer tsoo-ZAH-men INE-uh LER-zoong FIN-den

**Meaning:** "Can we find a solution together?"

**When to use it:** When ready to move from conflict toward resolution.

### Ich m√∂chte dich verstehen
**Pronunciation:** ikh MERKH-tuh dikh fair-SHTAY-en

**Meaning:** "I want to understand you"

**When to use it:** To show genuine interest in your partner's perspective.

### Was k√∂nnen wir tun?
**Pronunciation:** vahs KER-nen veer TOON

**Meaning:** "What can we do?"

**When to use it:** To shift focus from the problem to finding solutions together.

## Cultural Insights

Germans generally value directness in communication. What might seem blunt to English speakers is often simply clear communication in German culture. Don't interpret directness as coldness‚Äîit's usually a sign of respect and honesty.

Always use "du" (informal you) with your partner. Switching to "Sie" (formal you) during an argument would be strange and create unwanted distance.

German culture often values discussing issues thoroughly rather than avoiding them. Your partner may want to talk through a problem completely rather than "agreeing to disagree." This can lead to longer discussions but often more lasting resolutions.

## Practice for Real Moments

Learning these phrases when calm ensures they're available when emotions run high. Your German partner will notice and appreciate your effort to engage with difficult topics in their language. This investment in communication builds a stronger foundation for your relationship.
